definition: tail/remainder/remnant/extremity/sixth of the 28 constellations/classifier for fish
horse's tail/pointed posterior section of a locust etc

sentences.english: The rule of the pressure circumference distributing on the boat-tail's different sections is acquired.
sentences.chinese: 获得了旋转弹模型船尾不同截面圆周压力分布规律。

sentences.english: A spar rising aft from a mast to support the head of a quadrilateral fore-and-aft sail.
sentences.chinese: 从船尾桅杆伸出支撑船头四方形的船帆的圆材。

sentences.english: In complete darkness, I joined a couple of crew members at the back of the boat.
sentences.chinese: 天完全黑下来后，我来到船尾和几名船员汇合。

sentences.english: "Is it steady or moving astern?" the captain called out.
sentences.chinese: 目标是静止的还是在向船尾方向移动？

sentences.english: The lower aft corner of a fore-and-aft sail.
sentences.chinese: 从船尾桅杆伸出支撑船头四方形的船帆的圆材。

sentences.english: I start to draw my bow into stern notch of ice-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 把我船头拉入破冰船船尾凹部。

sentences.english: The stern gallery is accessibly only through the Captain's salon.
sentences.chinese: 船尾是通俗易懂仅通船长沙龙的画廊。

sentences.english: A second appeared at the stern, and let out a scream of pure catlike anger.
sentences.chinese: 另一只大猫出现在船尾，发出了一声愤怒的长啸。

sentences.english: When the stone man moved aft, Duck blocked his way, pole in hand.
sentences.chinese: 当石人想船尾逃去时，鸭子用篙封住了他的去路。

sentences.english: They build small fires in the sterns, grilling crustaceans and boiling thin mollusc stews.
sentences.chinese: 他们在船尾生火启灶，或炙烤海贝，或煮炖海鲜。
把船操纵使风对左舷船尾。

sentences.english: I found myself jammed in between the stern and rudder.
sentences.chinese: 我发现自己挤在船尾和船舵中间。

sentences.english: Make fast two tugs on each quarter.
sentences.chinese: 把每舷船尾两艘拖船绑牢。

sentences.english: We're not there yet, " said the oiler , in the stern."
sentences.chinese: “我们还没到那儿呢，”加油工在船尾说。

sentences.english: Stern and sides bas-reliefs. Rudder's carving next.
sentences.chinese: 船尾和侧面的浅浮雕，接下来是舵的雕刻件。

sentences.english: But he still stood steadily at the stern like a statue.
sentences.chinese: 但他仍然稳定的站在船尾，仿佛一座雕像。

definition: the bow or prow of a ship
sides of a ship/ship's railing/fig. the dividing line between shipboard expenses and onshore freight charges
